title: A Day and a Night
description:
Equinox arrives with bells and unease. The Order’s prophecy calls for a day and a night without stutter. The Loom of Tides thrums with fresh resonance and fear. Someone means to make it cough. The Embersleeve’s decoy chime has bought you a map of fingerprints, and Captain Maera has crews ready to crank by hand if you can keep saboteurs from cutting the belts that sing like river-serpents. The Starspan listens, counting cracks with patient malice older than politics.
The engine-house steams and whispers. You can smell the night market on one saboteur’s sleeves and the glassworks on another’s palms. Between the Wardens’ keys and the Collegium’s numbers lies a trust that could shatter or set. If you can hold rhythm steady until dawn kisses dusk again, the city will have bought itself more time than money can buy.
objectives: Enter the Loom of Tides through a hidden culvert wheel you learned in the Vaults
Identify saboteurs by triggering the decoy plate’s telltale flutter and isolate them
Coordinate with Maera’s crews to maintain manual flow while belts are retensioned
Seat the Skytooth resonance core and play the mirror-plate’s counter-tone to smooth the hum
Confront Knife-Whisper Pell and force an end to the masking attempt without a street war

dialogue.speaker: Asha Greyling
dialogue.text: If the Loom stutters, the arch remembers how to break. I have rung warnings until my hands blistered and still the city asked for proof. Give them proof of steadiness instead. Give them a day and a night that feels like a held breath released slowly, and I will write your name on a bell-clapper myself.

dialogue.speaker: Maera Lockfen
dialogue.text: My crews will crank until their arms scream. Keep knives off their backs and clever boys out of my gearings. If you see a hand reach where it shouldn’t, break the habit not the fingers. We’ll need those hands when the flood comes again, and it will.

dialogue.speaker: Magister Vell
dialogue.text: Listen—do you hear it? The ghost-harmonic is settling like a cat finding exactly the right place to sleep. Play the mirror-plate now, just a hair under E5, and then—good—ease it down. The belts won’t like it, but they don’t get a vote. Neither do the men who thought they could bully physics with a smuggled scale.

dialogue.speaker: Knife-Whisper Pell
dialogue.text: You think yourself a moral locksmith, and maybe you are. You turned a key I didn’t see and now you look at me like a door you can close forever. I never wanted the arch to break, Lio. I wanted a city that didn’t demand permission to breathe. Call your Wardens off my shadows and I will call my shadows off your daylight.

dialogue.speaker: Lio Fenwater
dialogue.text: We can unlearn the habit of choking each other by the throat. Walk with me into a hearing and say out loud that you’ll trade secrecy for a seat. I will write it on brass and hold your name steady while you say it. Keep playing at masks in the engine-room and you’ll force me to make an example you won’t like.

rewards: Crisis averted: the Loom runs a full day and night without stutter
Order’s formal blessing for the Oath hearing
Warden security writ for future infrastructure sites
